sentences.sContent: Let’s go back to camp – it’s getting dark.
sentences.sCn: 我们回营地吧，天快黑了。

sentences.sContent: a camp near Lake Ellen Wilson
sentences.sCn: 埃伦•威尔逊湖边的营地

sentences.sContent: The soldiers broke camp (= took down their tents etc ) and left before dawn.
sentences.sCn: 士兵们在黎明前拔营出发了。

sentences.sContent: We set up camp (= made the camping place ready ) at nearby Icicle Lake.
sentences.sCn: 我们在附近的冰柱湖边建了营地。

sentences.sContent: The expedition’s base camp (= main camp ) was 6,000 feet below the summit.
sentences.sCn: 探险队的大本营在山峰下面6,000英尺处。

phrases.pCn: 大本营；探险队等的营地；扑火营部；扑火野外指挥部
n. ［美口］海军训练新兵之营地
流动工人招待所；劳改所
（第二次世界大战期间纳粹的）死亡集中营（等于extermination camp）
囚犯劳动营；（青少年）劳动夏令营

words.tran: 露营；扎营；临时安顿（camp的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: a place where people stay in tents, shelters etc for a short time, usually in the mountains, a forest etc
